leetcode.notes: Hash map for O(n) lookup. Classic pattern: complement = target - num

leetcode.notes: Stack pattern. Push opening, pop and match for closing

leetcode.notes: Track min price so far, max profit = current - min

leetcode.name: Contains Duplicate
leetcode.notes: Set for O(1) lookup. Return true if len(set) != len(array)

leetcode.name: Product of Array Except Self
leetcode.notes: Two passes: left products then right products. Avoid division.

DDIA.notes: Data models: relational vs document vs graph. Each has trade-offs.

leetcode.name: Maximum Subarray
leetcode.notes: Kadane's algorithm: max(num, currentMax + num). Reset when sum goes negative.

leetcode.name: 3Sum
leetcode.notes: Sort first, then two pointers. Skip duplicates to avoid repeated triplets.

system_design.notes: Fan-out on write vs fan-out on read. Celebrities are special case - hybrid approach.

exploring: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood. Two hearts pump blood to gills, one to the body.

leetcode.notes: Dummy head trick. Compare and advance pointers.

leetcode.notes: Floyd's tortoise and hare. Fast catches slow if cycle exists.

leetcode.name: Reverse Linked List
leetcode.notes: Three pointers: prev, curr, next. Iterative is cleaner than recursive.

leetcode.name: Merge k Sorted Lists
leetcode.notes: Min heap of list heads. Pop smallest, push its next. O(N log k).

leetcode.name: LRU Cache
leetcode.notes: HashMap + doubly linked list. O(1) get and put.

system_design.name: Rate Limiter
system_design.notes: Token bucket vs sliding window. Trade-offs: memory vs accuracy.

DDIA.notes: Indexing strategies. B-tree for range queries, hash for point lookups.

leetcode.name: Binary Tree Level Order Traversal
leetcode.notes: BFS with queue. Track level size to separate levels.

leetcode.name: Validate Binary Search Tree
leetcode.notes: Pass min/max bounds down. Or do inorder and check sorted.

leetcode.name: Lowest Common Ancestor
leetcode.notes: Post-order: if both sides return non-null, current is LCA.

exploring: A day on Venus is longer than its year. It takes 243 Earth days to rotate but only 225 to orbit the Sun.

leetcode.name: Number of Islands
leetcode.notes: DFS flood fill. Mark visited by changing to '0'. Count DFS calls.

leetcode.name: Course Schedule
leetcode.notes: Topological sort with cycle detection. Three colors: unvisited, visiting, visited.

system_design.notes: Base62 encoding, consistent hashing for distribution. Read-heavy: cache aggressively.
